block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for March 24 to 30.
1. Mystery at Hong Kong Horse Racing Track Concerns have been raised about security for the six Olympic equestrian events that will be in Hong Kong. (Published March 27)
2. For Athletes, the Next Fountain of Youth? In a few years, stem cells may be used to grow knee ligaments and elbow tendons. (March 29)
3. So You Picked the Final Four? Join the Club This year's Final Four is the first since 1993 with no team seeded lower than No. 2. (March 26)
4. Swindal Divorce Shakes Up Yankee Hierarchy It is unlikely that Steve Swindal will succeed George Steinbrenner. (March 29)
5. Team Managers Expect Anything, and That's Not an Exaggeration Hundreds of team managers are the behind-the-scenes heroes of the basketball season. (March 25)
